children.value: An OrientedBoundingBox is a closed and convex cuboid. It can provide a tighter bounding volume than a bounding sphere or an axis aligned bounding box in many cases.
Create an OrientedBoundingBox using a transformation matrix, a position where the box will be translated, and a scale.
Sort bounding boxes from back to front
Compute an oriented bounding box enclosing two points.

Computes an instance of an OrientedBoundingBox of the given positions.
This is an implementation of Stefan Gottschalk's
Collision Queries using Oriented Bounding Boxes
points that the bounding box will enclose.

children.value: makeBoundingBoxfromRectangle(rectangle : Rectangle [, minimumHeight : Number, maximumHeight : Number, ellipsoid : Ellipsoid]) : OrientedBoundingBox
There are no guarantees about the orientation of the bounding box.
The cartographic rectangle on the surface of the ellipsoid.

The ellipsoid on which the rectangle is defined.

The center position of the box.
The transformation matrix, to rotate the box to the right position.
{Matrix3} [halfAxes=Matrix3.ZERO] The three orthogonal half-axes of the bounding box. Equivalently, the transformation matrix, to rotate and scale a cube centered at the origin.

The object onto which to store the result.
@returns {OrientedBoundingBox} A new OrientedBoundingBox instance.

Computes the estimated distance from the closest point on a bounding box to a point.
The estimated distance from the bounding sphere to the point.
Computes the estimated distance squared from the closest point on a bounding box to a point.
{Number} The estimated distance squared from the bounding sphere to the point.

properties.ariaLabel: computeplanedistancesposition  number3 direction  number3  result  number2  number2 permalink

children.value: computePlaneDistances(position : Number[3], direction : Number[3] [, result : Number[2]]) : Number[2]
The distances calculated by the vector from the center of the bounding box to position projected onto direction.
If you imagine the infinite number of planes with normal direction, this computes the smallest distance to the closest and farthest planes from position that intersect the bounding box.
The position to calculate the distance from.
An optional Interval to store the nearest and farthest distances.
The nearest and farthest distances on the bounding box from position in direction.
Determines which side of a plane the oriented bounding box is located.
if the entire box is on the side of the plane the normal is pointing
if the entire box is on the opposite side, and
if the box intersects the plane.
